trans-unit.source: Enables you to define which HTTP verbs are allowed when ASP.NET routing determines whether a URL matches a route.
The <xref:System.Web.Routing.HttpMethodConstraint> class enables you to limit route matching to certain HTTP verbs.
For example, you can specify that a route is considered a match for a URL only when the HTTP verb for the request is `POST`.

To set constraints for route matching, you set the <xref:System.Web.Routing.Route.Constraints%2A> property of the <xref:System.Web.Routing.Route> class to an instance of the <xref:System.Web.Routing.RouteValueDictionary> class.
To set an HTTP verb constraint, you set the value of one dictionary element to an <xref:System.Web.Routing.HttpMethodConstraint> object and the key to any name.
In the <xref:System.Web.Routing.HttpMethodConstraint.%23ctor%2A> method, you include all the HTTP verbs that are allowed for the route when ASP.NET routing determines whether the route matches a URL.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.Routing.HttpMethodConstraint"></xref> class by using the HTTP verbs that are allowed for the route.
The HTTP verbs that are valid for the route.
The allowedMethods parameter is `null`.
Gets the collection of allowed HTTP verbs for the route.
A collection of allowed HTTP verbs for the route.
Determines whether the request was made with an HTTP verb that is one of the allowed verbs for the route.
An object that encapsulates information about the HTTP request.
The object that is being checked to determine whether it matches the URL.
The name of the parameter that is being checked.
An object that contains the parameters for a route.
An object that indicates whether the constraint check is being performed when an incoming request is processed or when a URL is generated.
When ASP.NET routing is processing a request, `true` if the request was made by using an allowed HTTP verb; otherwise, `false`.
When ASP.NET routing is constructing a URL, `true` if the supplied values contain an HTTP verb that matches one of the allowed HTTP verbs; otherwise, `false`.
The default is `true`.
One or more of the following parameters is `null`: httpContext, route, parameterName, or values.

For a description of this member, see <xref href="System.Web.Routing.IRouteConstraint.Match(System.Web.HttpContextBase,System.Web.Routing.Route,System.String,System.Web.Routing.RouteValueDictionary,System.Web.Routing.RouteDirection)"></xref>.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Web.Routing.HttpMethodConstraint> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Web.Routing.IRouteConstraint> interface.
An object that encapsulates information about the HTTP request.
The object that is being checked to determine whether it matches the URL.
The name of the parameter that is being checked.
An object that contains the parameters for a route.
An object that indicates whether the constraint check is being performed when an incoming request is handled or when a URL is generated.
`true` if the request was made by using an allowed HTTP verb; otherwise, `false`.
The default is `true`.
One or more of the following parameters is `null`: httpContext, route, parameterName, or values.
